Personality theorist [[Erik Erikson]] related wisdom to the last stage of his eight-stage theory of psychosocial development. Erikson's theory spans the entire lifespan and frames each stage in the form of internally-generated questions or tensions. Erikson claimed that in the last stage of human development, from approximately 65 years to death, individuals must resolve a psychological conflict between integrity and despair. He proposed that attaining wisdom is a favorable resolution and product of this conflict.

Perhaps the most striking reference to 'wisdom' in our current psychological literature, derives from the research of '''[[Erik Erikson]]''' about the various psychological life-stages of human existence. The last of the Erikson life-stages offers all individuals the prospect of ''''wisdom''''.
+
Thus, within Eriksonian theory, wisdom universally surfaces as an optimal potential outcome of the human experience.
−   −
Erikson lists eight stages of human psychological development, spanning the entire lifespan, framed in the form of internally-generated questions, or tensions. Each of Erikson's stages of psychosocial development are marked by a conflict, for which successful resolution will result in a favourable outcome, for example, 'trust vs. mistrust', and by an important event that this conflict resolves itself around, for example, 'weaning'.
  −   −
It is significant to note that these internally-generated questions / tensions surface in an age-dependent fashion, yet these tensions are otherwise universal (i.e., they are not culture, gender, or language dependent). '''''Each life-stage tension has an optimal solution''''' that is potentially available to any individual: The actual solution in place in response to the tension may vary considerably, from person to person, and will likely be operational for a lifetime (unless otherwise changed).
  −   −
Stage 1: from birth to Year 1, ''''trust vs. mistrust''''; Optimal Potential Solution = ''''''Hope'''''';
  −   −
Stage 2: from 1-3 years, ''''autonomy vs. shame''''; Optimal Potential Solution = ''''''Will'''''' ;
  −   −
Stage 3: from 3-6 years, ''''initiative vs. guilt''''; Optimal Potential Solution = ''''''Purpose'''''';
  −   −
Stage 4: from 6-12 years, ''''industry vs.inferiority''''; Optimal Potential Solution = ''''''Competence'''''';
  −   −
Stage 5: 12-18 years, ''''identity vs. identity-confusion''''; Optimal Potential Solution = ''''''Fidelity'''''';
  −   −
Stage 6: 18-40 years, ''''intimacy vs.isolation''''; Optimal Potential Solution = ''''''Loving Solutions'''''';
  −   −
Stage 7: 40-65 years, ''''generativity vs.stagnation''''; Optimal Potential Solution = ''''''Caring'''''';
  −
  −
Stage 8: 65 years-death, ''''integrity vs.despair'''', Optimal Potential Solution = '''Wisdom'''.
  −   −

It seems quite remarkable that the concept of ''''''wisdom' surfaces as a universal optimal potential living experience''''' within the psychological space of all individuals.
